metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14386 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - high.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel before 5.9-rc4. Memory corruption can be exploited to gain root privileges from unprivileged processes. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity. Or Cohen discovered that the AF_PACKET implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly perform bounds checking in some situations. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14386` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-117-generic - 4.15.0-117.118
linux-image-4.15.0-117-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-117.118
linux-image-4.15.0-117-lowlatency - 4.15.0-117.118
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-117-generic - 4.15.0-117.118
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-117-lowlatency - 4.15.0-117.118
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1082-aws - 4.15.0-1082.86
No subscription required

linux-image-5.3.0-1035-aws - 5.3.0-1035.37
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-117.118').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1082.86').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
